Reviews.Title: “Memphis downtown”
Reviews.Author: illustratedmum33
Reviews.Content: We were not aware how bad the area was. Appears that some undesirables live in the motel rooms and not on vacation. They were up al night pacing from one room to the other..banging on doors etc. Looks like it is a bad area and would not advise to walk out at night. The toilet had blood on it and the bath plug did not exsist , meaning I could not enjoy a nice soak after a long day. On the plus side, the cleaning ladies seemed really friendly and the bed was a good size and comfy. Overall I would advise not to stay here and choose another motel like motel 6 graceland, which seemed better..we chose not to saty at downtown after 1 night and moved onto motle 6 graceland.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: JennSB
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as I am currently staying at this hotel. Look elsewhere if you are looking for a deal. The rooms have a weird smell and seem unclean. The neighborhood is far from desirable. It's in a seemlying unsafe looking neighborhood. Definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “No more or less than expected”
Reviews.Author: Collegestudent89
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Motel 6 with a friend during a music festival. I picked it because it was close enough to Beale St and it was the right price. The room was small and dingy as expected, but I didn't feel like it was dirty. It was easy, quick, and cheap to get a cab to Beale St which was the most important thing for me that weekend. But it's a motel 6, it exceededmy expectations by not having visible grime and stains. I would recommend this place of you're strapped for cash.

Reviews.Title: “VERY no frills, friendly staff, reasonably priced and good location”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in late May, occupying two rooms on the ground floor. We knew going in that Motel 6 was "No Frills", but we were primarily interested in this hotel's proximity to downtown Memphis - approximately 3-5 kms away. No frills means just that - no microwave, fridge, hair dryer, shampoo or iron. We were able to acquire an iron and blow dryer by leaving a $5.00 deposit for each. The rooms were clean and bright enough, while the hotel is also fenced in, probably to discourage the suspected drug dealers who periodically lingered nearby - but never bothered any of us. Parking was well lit and ample, while across the street was Japanese food which was quite good and reasonably priced, along with a Walgreens, Arbys and Burder King all nearby and within walking distance - DURING THE DAY ! CJ's was recommended by hotel staff as a good breakfast destination - the food was just OK, while waitress was terrible, and someone we never saw again after delivering our meal. Definately wouldn't recommend this restaurant ! Also at this hotel during tornado warnings, we did feel safe based on the concrete structure of this hotel, although the hotel staff were of little help in regards to any safety recommendations. If you're looking for a good location, with good value, just make sure you're prepared for the No Frills which await you, and you'll be fine. Also be smart in regards to personal safety, minimizing any walking around at night - particularly alone !

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not scummy”
Reviews.Author: fvlb
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here to watch the Dawgs lose at the Liberty Bowl. Check in was easy and everyone was nice. I have stayed in worse places for the $50 price. The location is great. It was a $10 (with tip) short cab ride to Beale Street. Everything we wanted was close. I didn't see any bed bugs or any other type of bugs and nothing was stolen. The shower was a nice surprise with great pressure. There are no hair dryers or fancy soaps..... it is a $50/nite motel. But for a $5 deposit you can rent a hair dryer from the front desk. My only real complaint is the room stunk of stale cigarettes. It really bothered my allergies (I am rarely exposed to smoke), so I had to benedryl up. If you want feather pillows, room service, and continental breakfast, then you will hate this place. If you just need a cheap and clean place to crash for a night or two, then this place might suit you. It also has wifi for a fee and HBO for free.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS !!!!”
Reviews.Author: dinagl
Reviews.Content: Don`t stay in this motel, it is full with BED BUGS. We went to sleep and the next morning we were full with bites. Only on my right arm I have 29 bites ! Now I am desperate because we are on the road, we go to visit my cousin in Florida, FULL WITH UGLY BITES, our luggage were in the room and there is a big possibility to have some bugs in our suitcase. We reported the case via e mail to Motel 6, and they answer that we have to isolate our clothes and wash them in hot water. Ha, ha ha! Now I am thinking very seriously to go back to LA, because I am afraid to go in my cousin home with bed bugs. Not to mention that the room was smelling bad, the carpet was FULL with stains Don`t go there!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: MissK01
Reviews.Content: If I had a choice in staying in this hotel, I definitely would NOT have! My parents booked this hotel for the soul purpose of being cheap as we were staying there for 9 days. I should have left when on the 2nd night of our stay someone tried to break into our room while we were sleeping. We called security and they took over 15 minutes to arrive. Of course we made a complaint to the front desk but she had no sympathy for what had happened. This didn't happen once but TWICE. On our 7th night stay, they same thing happened, someone tried breaking into our room. They tried so hard that my father had to force the door shut with his own body weight. We had to make so much noise to try and alert other guests and hopefully that would scare off the intruder ( I apologise!) . We did call the police followed by the security. We should have left the moment the first attempted break-in happened but finding another hotel was impossible during Elvis week. Towels were never replaced and had to continually ask for them at the front desk. The washer/dryer damaged my clothing and the bed and pillows were like sleeping on rocks. Overall I was shocked to know that a hotel like this could still be in business. The staff were not at all concerned about the break-in attempts and replied to our complaints as: "It happens" Before booking this hotel, please ask yourself: "Is my safety worth $50 a night?"

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: 510Traveler
Reviews.Content: Another stop on our road trip out east... We stayed here one night because it was cheap ($50), close to downtown (~1.5 miles), and pet-friendly. It is the most simple place you will possibly find and good if all you want is JUST a bed to sleep in for the night. As soon as we drove up, I was regretting our decision... Then we got inside... there was a brown spot on one of the hand towels, NO bath towels, black specks (like cigarette ashes) all over the plastic that covers the plastic cup, small bathroom, cracked hole in one of the drawers, small bathroom, and NO internet access. We drove around the building once before finding the check-in office, where there was one lady behind a counter with a phone and a computer. Other than that, the place was pretty much bare. It was the only place we stayed at where we paid up front and got a receipt for our stay at check-in. The only thing that made us feel better was that we had our dog (the place is pet-friendly and does not charge a fee), as we felt unsafe otherwise. There was a party of beer-drinking "white frat boys" staying in a few rooms some doors down, hanging out in front of their rooms... seems like it might have a been a good stay for them? Definitely DO NOT recommend for female travelers (solo OR group).

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: traumatizer
Reviews.Content: we wanted cheap and basic accomodation in memphis for 2 days whilst we saw the tourist traps. this motel suited us fine. it was about a half mile walk to sun studio which in turn runs a shuttle bus to graceland and the rock and soul museum. the room was clean with a huge bed and the bathroom was clean also.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare Without a Dream”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room for 2 nights. When I first checked in the electronic key to my room did not work. I had to go back to the front desk for it to be reset. The lamp on the bedside table with the phone and phonebooks did not work. Each light had to be turned on individually because the light switch at the door did not work. The bed was made up only with a blanket and sheet. Later on the maid came in and told me that she told the front desk the room was not ready (I checked in at 4:30PM on a Friday) and she put a quilt on the bed leaving the top part down exposing the pillows. The furniture had stains on them. The bathroom doorknob was loose and shaking. The next day at 10:33am the maid knocked on the door and I told her to come back later that we were out late. She never came back and told the front desk that I said I did not want my room cleaned. I had to go to the front desk to get me clean towels and soap. The last straw was later that night when I returned to the room with a bottle of wine and went to the ice machine so I can obtain ice to chill the wine. When I pushed the button there was no ice and my only resource was to scoop up ice that had fallen into the tray. Finally when I checked out the following morning I was given a triple A room rate. This I guess was for my pain and suffering.

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Memphis Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 210 South Pauline Street - I-240 at Union Avenue/Madison Avenue, Exit #30, Memphis, TN 38104 (Formerly Red Roof Inn)
